f/8 Photo Expeditions: Faroe Islands

Landscape photography & post-processing workshop

May 14–21, 2016

3 teachers, 7 days, 10 photographers.

Reserve your place! »

Discover one of Europe's last remaning hidden gems! This tiny archipelago is full of stunning waterfalls and rugged cliffs just waiting to be photographed.

Join three experienced photographers & travellers as we take you on a journey through the Faroe Islands. You’ll experience nature at it’s fullets, from mountains and waterfalls to ‘floating’ lakes and unbelieveable cliffs. With short drives to our favourite locations, and constant personal instruction from each one of us, you’ll have a learning experience like no other.

As well as learning how to shoot landscapes and the night sky with your DSLR (or film cameras / smartphone), our post-processing workshop will teach you everything you need to edit your images like a pro!

Catering to all levels

Whether you’re a complete beginner or seasoned pro, there’s something to be gained from this fantastic trip around the Faroe Islands.

We can help you improve a number of aspects of your photography, whether you shoot digital, film or simply on your smartphone.

A Faroese Photography Adventure

£1000

Saturday

We’ll pick you up from the airport and make sure you’re all set for the week ahead.

  • Arrival — transfer to our accommodation overlooking the capital of Tórshavn.
  • Introduction — Walk through the week’s plan, check our gear and research the weather conditions.
  • Answer any questions you have and run through some photography tips and techniques.
  • Dinner & drinks!

Sunday—Friday

We’ll spend the week exploring the various islands and start shooting the majestic scenery.

  • Sunrise shoot (weather permitting).
  • Visits to some of our favourite photography locations on the Faroe Islands.
  • See lakes, waterfalls, mountains, cliffs and more!

Saturday

A jam-packed day in Tórshavn to review and process the images you’ve taken on these magnificent islands!

  • Post-processing Master-class.
  • Smartphone editing
  • Photowalk around the city (smartphones ready!).
  • Farewell dinner & drinks.

What are you waiting for? Book now! »

Workshop Details

Interested in joining us? Here’s what you’ll need to know.

Where

We’ll be journeying around some of the most remote islands in the North Atlantic. Based in Tórshavn, we’ll hit some of our favourite photography locations around the archipelago.

What to bring

The landscapes are amazing, but the weather unpredictable. Here are just some of the things you’ll need:

  • Camera and lenses (plus things like batteries and memory cards)
  • Tripod
  • ND filters for daytime shooting
  • Appropriate clothing
  • Laptop for post-processing (Lightroom & Photoshop)
  • Smartphone (optional, but recommended)
  • Head torch
  • Passport!

What’s Included

  • Accommodation for the whole trip
  • Car hire
  • All fuel costs
  • Breakfast, lunch and dinner each day
  • Post-processing masterclass for all levels
  • Photowalk around Tórshavn

What’s Not Included

  • Air fare to and from Vágar (The Faroe Island’s main airport)
  • Alcoholic drinks
  • Visa costs (if applicable)
  • Travel & medical insurance

Smartphones Welcome

While you’ll likely want to capture the stunning landscapes of The Faroe Islands on the best camera possible, that doesn’t mean you should ignore the one in your pocket.

Bring your smartphone and prepare to learn how to shoot (and edit) amazing landscapes on the camera you always have with you.

With over 1 million followers on Instagram between them, Greg, Conor & Dan are the men to show you how.

Frequently Asked Questions

  • How is payment handled?

    We use a third-party service called Ti.to. This not only allows us secure online transactions, but we can accept numerous forms of payment from credit card to PayPal — whatever suits you best!

  • What about flights?

    Flights to the Faroe Islands are not included, so shop around for the best deal (as always, the earlier you book, the better). You can fly with Atlantic Airways from Edinbugh, Copenhagen, Barcelona and Reykjavik, amongst others. Let us know if you have any questions whatsoever!

  • What type of accommodation should I expect?

    We’ll be staying at Hotel Føroyar, a beautiful four star hotel overlooking the Faroese capital of Tórshavn.

  • What if the weather is bad?

    The weather in the Faroe Islands can be wet and foggy. This can actually make for some fantastically moody photography! If it gets too bad, we will have a Plan B in the case of extremely severe (aka unsafe) weather, involving food and post-processing.

  • What skill levels do you teach?

    We teach everyone from beginners to advanced photographers. Even if you don’t have a DSLR, we can help you get the best out of whatever camera you bring along (get in touch if you have any gear-specific questions prior to booking).

  • What if I need more information?

    Feel free to contact us with any queries that you may have. Once you are registered, we will send out an information pack prior to the workshop with more details. You can also tweet Conor (@thefella), Greg (@greg_a) or Dan (@danrubin).

  • What about cancellations?

    In general, we do not offer refunds, however: Depending on when you cancel and your reasons, we will do our best to refund all or some of your registration fee. You are also more than welcome to transfer your place to someone else if you can’t make it. Please check our complete Terms & Conditions for more details.
